column3: I don't think this fixes the mentioned issue; this will prevent `-min` from doing anything at all in case of minimize to tray but there is no tray icon.\nBut the reported issue seems to be that `-min` doesn't do the right thing in case minimize-to-tray is enabled.

@laanwj 
Thank you for your review.

> ... this will prevent `-min` from doing anything at all in case of minimize to tray but there is no tray icon.

To be exact this will prevent `-min` from doing anything in case of minimize to tray _and_ there _is_ a tray icon. A user will get a tray icon on the desktop; the main window will be hidden, i.e., it'll be effectively minimized to the tray
